question:
The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has formulated a National Policy for treatment of Rare Diseases (NPRD) in India. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. As per WHO, a lifelong disease or disorder condition with a prevalence of 1 or less, per 1000 population is defined as a rare disease
  2. The new policy aims at setting up of a corpus fund at Central level with the initial amount of Rs.100 crore and a similar corpus at State level for the treatment of rare diseases
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. As per WHO, a lifelong disease or disorder condition with a prevalence of 1 or less, per 1000 population is defined as a rare disease. <u>Second statement is correct</u>. The new policy aims at setting up of a corpus fund at Central level with the initial amount of Rs.100 crore and a similar corpus at State level for the treatment of rare diseases. All genetic disorders are rare diseases. Children are the main sufferer from rare diseases. Approximately 50% of the people affected by rare diseases in the world are children.
